content.question: /** Precondition: 0 <= numVals <= nums.length */ public static int mystery(int[] nums, int v, int numVals) { if (numVals == 0) { return 0; } else if (v == nums[numVals - 1]) { return 1 + mystery(nums, v, numVals - 1); } else { return mystery(nums, v, numVals - 1); } } Which of the following best describes the value returned by the call mystery(nums, v, nums.length) ?

choices.label: The number of times that v occurs in nums is returned.
The number of times that numVals occurs in nums is returned.
Nothing is returned. A runtime error occurs because of infinite recursion.

content.answer: The number of times that v occurs in nums is returned.

skill.text: 4.A: Describe the behavior of a code segment or program.
